Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk nuxwdog
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: nuxwdog bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The nuxwdog packages provide a watchdog daemon that is used to start, stop, and monitor system processes, as well as to prompt users for passwords when required. Additionally, interfaces to the client code for various programming languages are included to allow clients to interact with the nuxwdog daemon. This update fixes the following bug: The nuxwdog daemon does not require a GUI to run. As nuxwdog is one of the packages that depended on non-headless java packages, about 300 MB of packages were installed unnecessarily when installing the pki-server and other pki-* packages. As nuxwdog is primarily used by pki-server, which is in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 accessed through the CLI by Identity Management (IdM), the nuxwdog packages now require only java-headless instead of java packages because the java graphics classes are not needed. As a result, java packages are not installed because of a removed dependency in nuxwdog. Note that efforts are still underway to remove the dependency on java (as opposed to java headless) in other dependencies of pki-server. (BZ#1283338) Users of nuxwdog are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
